title.rendered: “Successful IDF Operation in Shifa Hospital: High-Level Terrorists Captured and Eliminated, Claims Chief of Staff”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

Chief of Staff in Shifa Hospital: This operation has achieved its goal – a large number of captured terrorists and senior operatives killed.

The Chief of Staff arrived yesterday (Wednesday) at the Shifa Hospital in the Gaza Strip, where IDF forces are still operating to arrest terrorists. The Chief of Staff conducted a review with the commander of the Southern Command, Major General Yaron Finkelmann, the commander of Brigade 162, Brigadier General Itzik Cohen, the commander of the 13 squadron, Colonel A’, and additional commanders.

From the words of the Chief of Staff, Lieutenant General Hertzi Halevy: “Almost two weeks, very, very successful, and this is an operation that I tell you, to plan it during a war, to execute it within a war, to carry it out properly within a war, is very, very complex. The achievements are very high, there is the execution of a tactical concept that is very impressive, there is a very, very important message, a hospital is not a safe place. We do everything not to harm the patients, not to harm the medical teams, by the way, the fact that this operation, didn’t hurt a single medical staff member, didn’t hurt any patients and a lot of very many terrorists were killed, a lot of terrorists were arrested, this is a level of warfare very, very high, very high. So far, the achievements are very high and I’m telling you, no one can roll back such a large amount of captured terrorists, such a large amount of killed terrorists, so many senior operatives, and a shaking of the notion that we can be in a place and they can’t touch us. This operation is not over yet, this operation has achieved its goal to a very high level and this operation continues to be carried out thoroughly until we announce that we have finished.”

A video clip with the remarks of the Chief of Staff is attached: https://bit.ly/4cO8CUa

An attached video on the topic: https://bit.ly/4cGxQUr

Photos on the topic included: https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC300324001285
